name: Jungle Bay, Dominica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Jungle Bay due to high marks given on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Naturally fun

likes.disliked: — Airport lines and luggage arrival delay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You need some good legs to enjoy the sights as there are lots of steps to and from the cabins. We wanted an active vacation so we took the offered package that included daily activites and evening massages. It was a great combination. The Boiling Lake excursion was difficult and rewarding at the same time. The cabin was special having no glass windows or television. While there were lizards to be seen we hardly saw an insect at all. Our trips to towns were interesting as was the time spent snorkling, and enjoying the local sights. Truely friendly people everywhere we went.
reviews.title: Jungle Bay - An AWESOME ESCAPE!

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING! The off-the-beaten path, non-exploited Jungle Bay resort is perfect for outdoor travelers! Dominica is a beautiful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you have someone special to spend some time with then this is a great place to go. One caution is to plan to bring 2 nights of supplies in your carry on as the airlines have delays in getting luggage to arrive on time.
reviews.title: Beautifully tranquil just a few tweaks needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jungle Bay staff know how to showcase their beautiful facility. The food was wonderful too. The office has a safe to keep your valuables and two computers to keep you as connected as you want. Some of the hikes we took were challenging and the guides took the time to keep us safe and entertained.
reviews.title: Jungle Bay Revives The Soul

likes.disliked: — Slow internet...aol was not accessible while we were there. But hotmail worked fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to pay a fee to leave the country (about $22 US). We met some nice folks here too. Very enjoyable time.
reviews.title: Everthing we expected and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Jungle Bay over Thanksgiving. It is a long ride from the airport, but everything in Dominica is a pretty long ride. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The food was good, but there aren't alot of options. The fish was basically the same every night, the chicken dish, the vegetarian option and appetizers changed nightly. The excursions and the guides and drivers are simply wonderful. They are all so friendly and very helpful. There are 35 cottages scattered throughout, but if you don't like to climb or too much exercise (then you shouldn't be going to Dominica) this place may not be right for you. We had about 130 stairs we had to climb and it was a little hard after the Boiling Lake tour, but we managed fine. Also, if you don't like lizards go someplace else. We left our windows and doors open and they are all over the property. We had no problem with mosquitos.
reviews.title: Great People! Great Escape! Great Island

likes.disliked: — Food was good, but not many options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just a really relaxing time. We'd rise around 6 or 6:30 get some breakfast, go on an excursion, take some rest, eat dinner, read a little in the hammock and goto sleep.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The island of Dominica is such a wonderful place. We can't wait to go back. Although, I will warn you that the price of taxis add up so keep that in mind. It costs about $70 to go many of the places you want to visit.
reviews.title: Nice place, shame about the food and the massages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Terrific location, staff, accomodations, food,activities,and facilities! Go there before the island gets developed and loses its charm.
reviews.title: Getting It All at Jungle Bay

likes.liked: — tastefully beautifully appointed cottages, clean, outdoor private shower, in the rainforest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with most of the positive reviews about the setting and the quality of the rooms and the peaceful secluded nature of Jungle Bay. The food, however, was quite disappointing. We were not on the adventure package so we had to pay for our meals and, frankly, the prices were staggering. Most of the evening meals we had here cost us more than they would have done at a decent restaurant back home in New York City and the quality was mediocre at best. Saying that, the whole experience of being at Jungle Bay was very pleasant. The owners were quite personable and the staff were very friendly. The massages my wife and I had were also expensive and disappointing - my own near-$100 massage felt like something you would experience from someone who'd watched a video of a person giving a massage and thought "ooh, that looks easy - I'll give that a go." I was underwhelmed, to say the least. If you like swimming, you might be disappointed with the pool area, too - the pool is not large and there are nowhere near enough loungers, towels and cushions for the lodge's guests. The beach, on the other hand, is stunning. Rocky, mostly deserted and pounded by an unforgiving Atlantic swell. Magical!
reviews.title: An island retreat filled with activity and local charm

likes.liked: — Great view with a comfortable bed and plenty of room.
likes.disliked: — Open air windows lets the lizards and birds come and go as they pleased during the night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you do not like nature this island and this resort is NOT for you.
reviews.title: For the Love of Water & Nature!!!

likes.liked: — A chance to be a part of nature without distubing it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Dominica's landscape is about 70% rain forest, with superb hiking trails, & waterfalls at every unexpected corner. This hotel offers packages that combine a stay in one of its 35 cottages on stilts with tours, hikes, yoga, meals, and a sea-view pool.
reviews.title: The best ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our cottage was embedded in the hillside surrounded by trees, rivers, birds and of course the ocean. The room gave a 180 degree view of nature, as windows were alongside 3 of the 4 walls. To add to the feel of nature the outdoor shower was the absolute BEST... It was large enough to fit 5 people and secure enough to make you feel right at home.
reviews.title: Excellent Adventure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mosquito bites were not existent, as each bed was accompanied with a net. This added to the security and comfort of leaving every window open so that I could enjoy the sound of the ocean waves, humming birds, crickets, river and the occasional rain. It has been years since I have had such good sleep.
reviews.title: Extreme Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Overall my stay at this resort was superb. The food was great, the tours interesting and hikes were scenic. My top 5 things about this Resort & Island are:
reviews.title: My wife and I loved Jungle Bay.

likes.disliked: — Arduous hike to the bungalow and the mosquitos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our entire family of 2 adults, 1 teenager and a young adult were all so sad to leave Jungle Bay. Jungle Bay is a true eco-lodge in which our family had 2 cottages, which resemble tree houses. The cottages were simple and rustic yet beautiful. Openings, sans glass served as windows and the shower, though private is outside. So we had the feeling of being outside even when we were inside our cottage. The island of Dominica is magnificent- mountains and jungle with some of the most beautiful flora we've ever seen. Jungle Bay is a well-run property, with owner Sam always present and on top of things. His staff, in particular the guides are really interesting people who take a great deal of pride in their work. They guided us through several challenging, fun hikes and helped us feel very safe. The food is good, with only a few disappointments-lunch especially was good and consistent. The food has yummy and interesting Caribbean flavor. Could use some work on desserts. Jungle Bay is a very fun, very relaxing place for those looking for an active trip and trying to avoid the traditional beach, fight over a lounge chair culture.
reviews.title: One of our best, active family vacations

likes.liked: — setting, staff, high activity level, not touristy beach crowd, all-inclusive, low stress environment, eco-tourism
likes.disliked: — inconvenient to get to from Chicago-required an overnight stay in San Juan, drive from airport long on windy road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here the first week of December and loved it. This eco-sensitive property is also culture-respectful and supportive of the interests of the local population. All the food is local and delicious: fresh/unique fruits and vegetables, great fish, "cocoa tea", and wonderful use of ginger, cinnamon, coconut, and, of course, rum. Ask Joanne(who runs the restaurant) or Janet(the head cook) to make the pumpkin-ginger soup---unbelievable! The local coffee is not a Starbucks blend for sure, but does the job.
reviews.title: An amazing jewel in the jungle!

likes.disliked: — Distance from airport and trailheads(requiring long drives)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cottages are essentially very spacious and comfortable treehouses; the exterior shower is a real treat. The immersion in the jungle's sights, smells, and sounds is very soothing. The king bed was superbly firm and comfortable.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The resort should not be considered a "destination resort", in that, while wonderfully comfortable, it's really best thought of as home base for the amazing hikes, trips, and other activities offered by Jungle Bay. This is a place for at least moderately active folks.; the joys of Dominica are really revealed on the trails, at the base of the waterfalls, and among the people there.
reviews.title: The Best of Both Worlds

likes.liked: — It was such a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For me, the very best aspect of my stay there was, in fact, the interactions with the Dominicans. The resort's staff are amazingly friendly, helpful, skilled, and accommodating. Stevenson and "Brudder" are terrific guides on the hikes--knowledgeable, resourceful, and patient. Steven is a real utility player--waiter, bartender, and folk dancer. Noreen is a great massage therapist. The owners, Sam & Glenda Raphael, set the tone for their employees by being extraordinarily friendly, interactive, and helpful way beyond the call of duty. Sam even loaned me a couple of DVD movies for my laptop!
reviews.title: Jungle Bay is THE BEST!!

likes.liked: — View, Food, sound of the surf at night and the sunrise in the morning

description: Award winning Jungle Bay rises from a cliff overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. Stay in one of the 35 rustic luxury cottages suspended on wooden posts amidst jungle fauna, each with a private outdoor shower and with the ever-present sound of ocean surf. Daily adventure tours are a highlight and include transportation in open-air safari trucks. Finish each day being pampered in ocean-view spa and dining at the Pavilion Restaurant, enjoying mouthwatering local organic cuisine.
